2025-11-28TCAeronautics ActRegulations Amending the Canadian Aviation Regulations (Personnel Licensing and Training)Regulations Amending the Canadian Aviation Regulations (Personnel Licensing and Training) in order to (1) clarify provisions and address inconsistent use of terminology; (2) address discrepancies between the English and French versions of the Regulations; (3) address concerns raised by the Standing Joint Committee for the Scrutiny of Regulations related to sub-delegated authorities; (4) codify two longstanding exemptions to permit Transport Canada test pilots to fly planes for testing purposes without having the type rating for that specific aircraft, and to permit participation in a simulator as another means to meet recency requirements; (5) add definitions for “family member” and “cross-country flight time”; (6) align validity periods with current industry practice for aviation document booklets in relation to expert level language proficiency as well as clarify validity periods for medical certificates; (7) remove unnecessary administrative requirements related to record retention and operation of satellite bases; and (8) address a Transportation Safety Board's recommendation related to instrument flight rules recency requirements.Registration: SOR/2025-0241 Publication Date: 2025-12-17
subject: Regulations Amending the Canadian Aviation Regulations (Personnel Licensing and Training)
precis: Regulations Amending the Canadian Aviation Regulations (Personnel Licensing and Training) in order to (1) clarify provisions and address inconsistent use of terminology; (2) address discrepancies between the English and French versions of the Regulations; (3) address concerns raised by the Standing Joint Committee for the Scrutiny of Regulations related to sub-delegated authorities; (4) codify two longstanding exemptions to permit Transport Canada test pilots to fly planes for testing purposes without having the type rating for that specific aircraft, and to permit participation in a simulator as another means to meet recency requirements; (5) add definitions for “family member” and “cross-country flight time”; (6) align validity periods with current industry practice for aviation document booklets in relation to expert level language proficiency as well as clarify validity periods for medical certificates; (7) remove unnecessary administrative requirements related to record retention and operation of satellite bases; and (8) address a Transportation Safety Board's recommendation related to instrument flight rules recency requirements.
